Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

THE WORLD OF UBISOFT

Ubisoft’s 19,000 team members, working across more than 30 countries around the world, are bound by a common mission to enrich players’ lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their commitment and talent have brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin’s Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come. Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds and perspectives are key to creating worlds where both players and teams can thrive and express themselves. If you are excited about solving game-changing challenges, cutting edge technologies and pushing the boundaries of entertainment, we invite you to join our journey and help us create the unknown.

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile brings together dedicated and experienced professionals that are focused on crafting high-quality F2P games for mobile. We strongly believe in the core values at the centre of our Ubilife, which encourage us to take ownership of our work, continually striving for excellence while promoting the sharing of knowledge across individuals and teams, without losing our sense of enjoyment and fun, while taking care for one another. We strive for a safe and respectful workplace for all team members and we’re transparent about the measures we are taking to do so. For this reason, Ubisoft’s Code of Conduct has been released publicly on our corporate website for all current and future team members.

Do you want to join us in the world of mobile gaming? If so, read on!

Job Description

YOUR DAILY ADVENTURE

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile is currently seeking a Data Analyst to help our team on their next adventure. The Data Analyst will support insight initiatives for our BI team. This person will report to the Live Producer. Your daily adventure:



Turning data into actionable insights, by performing hands-on research, data exploration and analysis, to drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention, and monetization.
Work with the game teams to provide insights into user behaviour, answer key business questions and support in AB test design and analysis.
Carry out projects on machine learning for behavioural segmentation and monetization.
Debugging and problem-solving issues to ensure the delivery of accurate and clear analysis, reports and tools.
Effectively communicate results and insights to senior stakeholders throughout the organization.
Coordinate, challenge and share the best analytical practices and methods within the organization.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in Machine Learning technologies and Data Science trends.
Contribute to the knowledge base and culture of the team.



Qualifications

YOUR SKILLS

Are you serious about fun? Do you consistently seek out learning opportunities and aim to beat your high score? Are you open to new ideas, perspectives and cultures and believe that it takes a world to build a world? At Ubisoft, you’ll work alongside passionate and talented teams who are imagining the future of entertainment.



Master's degree in a quantitative field (i.e. Physics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science...). PhD in any of these disciplines is a plus.
5+ years relevant work experience in similar positions, ideally in mobile gaming industry.
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis
Experience with cloud-based big data solutions such as Redshift, BigQuery.
Solid knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Microstrategy, etc.
Robust understanding of advanced statistics suitable for analysis of skewed populations.
Experience designing effective ways of communicating, visualising and reporting results/analysis.
Experience in predictive analytics and segmentation.
Excellent problem-solving capabilities with strong attention to details.
Work permit for Spain obtained prior to applying for the position is a must.



What can make you stand out:



Experience with Agile philosophies (e.g.: Scrum, Kanban, XP) and project management tools (e.g.: JIRA)
Software engineering skills, including best practices like CI/CD and Git.
Self-motivation, organization skills, team spirit, proactivity.
Passion for games. Interest in mobile F2P games.



Additional Information

YOUR LIFE AT UBISOFT BARCELONA MOBILE (and PERKS)



Hybrid Work Model
Possibility for new parents to work from home 80% of the time.
Flex working schedule: 40hrs per week with start time between 8 AM – 10 AM and leave from 5 PM (Friday from 2 PM).
Reduced schedule (35 hrs per week) in July and August, Easter, Christmas holidays, and special days like Sant Jordi and Revetlla de Sant Joan.
Personal Matters Hours: 24 hours paid for by Ubisoft that you can use for personal matters.
Holidays: 25 days per year + 1 day in your Ubi-Birthday.
5 extra holiday days on the year you celebrate your 5th/10th/15th/20th year with us.
Ticket Restaurant: 200€ per month, and Flexible compensation plan (Ticket Transport & Ticket Nursery).
Health insurance with Cigna, including Physiotherapist & Psychology sessions with a reduced price.
Life Insurance with AXA.
Mobile Device Grant of 400 EUR starting on your 1st year in the company.
Language trainings in English, Spanish, and French.
Professional development training & programs, based upon request.
Ubisoft games with discount and Uplay PC for free.
Locally roasted craft coffee by INCAPTO (it’s very, very good).

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
🚀 Are you the NEX T Data Analyst? 🚀


O que valorizamos:

  • Licenciatura em Engenharia Informática, Estatística, Matemática ou áreas afins;
  • Domínio de SQL e Python;
  • Experiência com ferramentas de ETL como SSIS;
  • Conhecimentos sólidos em Power BI e SSRS para criação de dashboards, relatórios e visualizações impactantes;
  • Pensamento crítico e raciocínio analítico para tomada de decisões baseadas em dados;
  • Capacidade de inovação e pensamento criativo para resolução de problemas fora do padrão;
  • Excelentes habilidades de apresentação e comunicação visual e verbal;


O que podes esperar desta função:

📍 Lisboa

💻 Híbrido

  • Extração, transformação e análise de dados para suportar decisões estratégicas;
  • Criação de relatórios e dashboards que comuniquem insights de forma clara e acionável;
  • Colaboração com stakeholders para entender necessidades de negócio e traduzir em soluções de dados;
  • Aplicação de boas práticas estatísticas para validar hipóteses e análises;
  • Participação em iniciativas de melhoria contínua e transformação digital.


O que te proporcionamos:

  • Equipa dinâmica e profissional;
  • Possibilidade de participação em projetos locais ou internacionais;
  • Acompanhamento personalizado;
  • Plano de Formação adequado às tuas necessidades;
  • Orientação para a progressão e desenvolvimento de carreira;
  • Oportunidade para fazer parte de uma equipa em grande crescimento.

Se os dados são o teu idioma e gostas de os transformar em impacto real, esta vaga é para ti! 💡

Junta-te à NEX T e faz a diferença com análise, visão e propósito.


Partilha o teu CV para your@nextengineering.pt com a REFª AOL.

Title: Estágio Profissional - Data Analytics
HTML:
A ANA faz parte do Grupo VINCI, que é o operador privado líder mundial no seu sector, gerindo uma rede de mais de 70 aeroportos em 13 países da Europa, Ásia, África e Américas.


A Área Administrativa e Financeira da Direção do Aeroporto Humberto Delgado pretende recrutar um(a) estagiário(a) para um estágio profissional de Data Analytics.


Principais atividades a desenvolver:

  • Analisar grandes volumes de dados para identificação e monitorização de KPI financeiros;
  • Apoiar no desenvolvimento de modelos financeiros de apoio à área administrativa e de faturação;
  • Apoiar no desenvolvimento de sistemas de cálculo de custos;
  • Contribuir para a automatização de tarefas rotineiras:
  • Conceber e implementar ferramentas e metodologias de análise de dados para a melhoria da qualidade e precisão dos dados.


Requisitos:

  • Licenciatura em Gestão, Economia, Informática de Gestão, Informática, Matemática Aplicada à Gestão, Engenharia Industrial ou qualificação similar;
  • Experiência na utilização de MS Office e proficiência em Excel;
  • Experiência em ferramentas de visualização de dados Power BI, SQL, SAP/BO e Python é uma vantagem;
  • Fluência em Inglês (falado e escrito);
  • Boa capacidade de interpretação dos dados, responsabilidade, proatividade e gosto pelo trabalho em equipa.


Perfil:

  • Elevado grau de auto-iniciativa, auto-independência e capacidade analítica;
  • Boa capacidade de organização e planeamento;
  • Capacidade de trabalho em equipa e bom relacionamento interpessoal (necessário para interagir com as diversas áreas da empresa);
  • Flexibilidade e agilidade para entregar resultados em curto espaço de tempo.


Outras informações:

Local do estágio: Lisboa

Duração do estágio: 12 meses

Início do estágio: a acordar com o(a) Candidato(a) selecionado(a)


Diversidade e inclusão:

A nossa cultura está baseada na diversidade das origens e das experiências. A ANA opõe-se a quaisquer formas de discriminação na contratação, nas relações laborais e no desenvolvimento profissional dos seus colaboradores. Comprometendo-se a promover a igualdade de oportunidades, independentemente do género, idade, religião ou crença, orientação sexual, ideologia política, raça ou etnia.

Title: Junior Analyst (Data)
Description:
About the Department




Banking Supervision carries out on-site and ongoing supervision of licensed banks. The Banking Supervision team comprises professionals with a financial services academic background, but also legal and IT professionals to support policy and supervisory work.




About the Role




As Junior Analyst you will be responsible for the following main duties:
Monitoring, quantitative and qualitative analysis of information submitted and published by credit institutions;
Draw up reporting performance assessments for credit institutions, including challenging the quality of data as submitted/published by institutions;
Utilize available data extraction and visualisation tools to interpret data and present findings
Liaison with relevant stakeholders including credit institutions, the ECB, the EBA and others in connection with ongoing and/or ad-hoc tasks;
Proactive participation in exercises and projects undertaken by the Data Team (planned and ad-hoc), including both in-house projects and those with European Supervisory Authorities (EBA, ECB, other);
Support participation in local/EBA/ECB working groups, as well as other European regulatory bodies as may be required;
Assist in the development and implementation of new data collection initiatives and analytical frameworks.
Participate in continuous improvement initiatives to enhance team efficiency and effectiveness
General office management and administrative duties including stationery orders, invoicing, coordinating attendance reports, archiving and other admin-related tasks as necessary;
Direct support to the Head of function, including scheduling and coordination within Banking Supervision and other MFSA functions.
You will also be expected to undertake any other duties that may arise depending on the exigencies of Banking Supervision and the Authority.




About You




We are looking for candidates with background in Banking, Finance, Accountancy, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics or in a related subject.

The role calls for an academic qualification in a relevant field of study at National Qualification Framework Level 6 or better, duly certified by the Malta Qualifications Recognition Information Centre (MQRIC) or a widely recognised professional qualification at a comparable level.

Having experience working in the area of financial services, especially within compliance and/or data, will be considered an asset. Candidates with longer working experience relevant to the role, or with proven knowledge of Excel and Business Intelligence Tools (such as PowerBI) will be preferred.




If you do not have the necessary academic or professional qualifications but you have at least five (5) years of relevant experience within the financial services environment, we would still be interested in speaking with you.




Other Information




The MFSA is an Equal Opportunities Employer as certified by the NCPE (National Commission for the Protection of Equality) and is committed to a policy of equal opportunity in all aspects of employment and will take care to avoid any form of discrimination in its recruitment procedures. The MFSA reserves the right to withdraw this call at any time and not to select any of the Candidates.

It is the responsibility of applicants in possession of qualifications awarded by Universities and other similar institutions outside Malta to produce a recognition statement on comparability of qualifications issued by the Malta Qualifications Recognition Information Centre (MQRIC). Applicants should do so preferably at application stage or otherwise at the preliminary interview should an applicant be selected for such interview. Details can be obtained by accessing the National Commission for Further and Higher Education website on www.ncfhe.gov.mt under MQRIC heading.

The MFSA shall ensure that any processing of personal data is in accordance with Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (General Data Protection Regulation), the Data Protection Act (Chapter 586 of the Laws of Malta) and any other relevant European Union and national law. For further details, you may refer to the Data Protection Policy on the MFSA webpage www.mfsa.mt.

Candidates are to note that the submission of any false statement/s or omission, even if unintended, may lead to the cancellation of their application and may render the candidate's appointment liable to termination.

Furthermore, please note that candidates may be asked to submit any documentation in support of the information provided, including but not limited to, proof of qualifications and Police Conduct Certificates.




Public call number: 881/2023

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Business Data Analyst

Sector: Fintech

Location: Dublin (Hybrid)

Salary: €55,000 – €60,000 plus bonus, health and pension




Our Client

Our client is a Fintech with a strong international footprint and a reputation for delivering intelligent data solutions across the financial services sector. With a focus on innovation, cross-functional collaboration, and operational excellence, they are continually investing in their people and platforms to stay ahead of evolving market demands.




Why should you apply?

This opportunity offers the chance to join a high-performing data team at a critical time of platform enhancement and modernisation. The successful candidate will play a central role in developing high-impact datasets and dashboards that support strategic decision-making. You will gain exposure to leading-edge cloud technologies in a role that balances technical depth with business engagement. The company also promotes flexible work arrangements, excellent learning and development pathways, and a highly supportive team environment.




Who should apply?

This role is ideal for an experienced data professional looking to deepen their analytics expertise in a commercially impactful environment:

At least 3 years of experience in a data analytics or business intelligence role.
Proficient with data visualisation tools such as Power BI or Tableau.
Strong SQL skills and exposure to Python, R, or similar.
Experience working with cloud-based data warehousing tools is advantageous.
Able to interpret data meaningfully and communicate findings clearly to stakeholders.
Analytical thinker with strong organisational and prioritisation skills.




Role and Reporting Lines

You will report to a senior data leader within a structured analytics function that collaborates across business units. Core responsibilities will include:

Data Architecture – Assist in the design and maintenance of core datasets to support analytics needs.
Visualisation – Create clear, insightful dashboards and performance reports for various teams.
Insight Delivery – Identify trends and deliver actionable insights that guide business strategies.
Data Quality – Support the development of data quality frameworks and conduct regular audits.
Cross-functional Collaboration – Liaise with technology and operations teams to refine data sources and ensure alignment with business goals.
Best Practice – Contribute to the adoption of industry-leading analytics standards.
Training – Educate internal users on data literacy and the use of reporting tools.
Documentation – Maintain structured guidance on processes, governance, and technical configurations.




Interested in this position?

To apply, please submit your CV to Emma Murphy, who is managing this assignment, via the link below.

Title: Junior Data Analyst - (Remote - Poland)
Description:
About Jobgether

Jobgether is a Talent Matching Platform that partners with companies worldwide to efficiently connect top talent with the right opportunities through AI-driven job matching.

One of our companies is currently looking for a Junior Data Analyst in Poland.

As a Junior Data Analyst, you will support ongoing data initiatives by maintaining and enhancing existing analytics reports and dashboards. Working closely with Product Managers and Engineers, you'll play a key role in analyzing site functionality and recommending improvements. You'll use your skills in SQL, Excel, and BI tools to extract and interpret data, optimize reporting processes, and visualize meaningful insights. This is a great opportunity for an analytical mind at the beginning of their data career, eager to grow in a collaborative and dynamic environment.

Accountabilities:


Maintain and develop analytics reports and dashboards
Collaborate with product and engineering teams to analyze website functionality
Build data aggregation tables to support reporting needs
Optimize dashboard performance and load times
Communicate findings and ideas for improvements clearly across teams
Visualize data insights to support business decisions



Requirements


At least 1 year of experience as a data or web analyst
Basic knowledge of Tableau and/or other BI tools (Power BI, Qlik Sense)
Practical experience with SQL (minimum 1 year)
Strong Excel skills for data manipulation and reporting
Understanding of probability theory and statistics
English proficiency at an intermediate level or higher



Benefits


Sports compensation and medical coverage
Psychological and home-office support
Remote work options and coworking space reimbursement
Childcare budget, maternity and paternity leave
Extra paid days off for family-related events
Supportive, growth-oriented culture with open communication
High tolerance for experimentation and learning from mistakes



Jobgether hiring process disclaimer

This job is posted on behalf of one of our partner companies. If you choose to apply, your application will go through our AI-powered 3-step screening process, where we automatically select the 5 best candidates.

Our AI thoroughly analyzes every line of your CV and LinkedIn profile to assess your fit for the role, evaluating each experience in detail. When needed, our team may also conduct a manual review to ensure only the most relevant candidates are considered.

Our process is fair, unbiased, and based solely on qualifications and relevance to the job. Only the best-matching candidates will be selected for the next round.

If you are among the top 5 candidates, you will be notified within 7 days.

If you do not receive feedback after 7 days, it means you were not selected. However, if you wish, we may consider your profile for other similar opportunities that better match your experience.

Thank you for your interest!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job title: Data Analyst

Location: Budapest – Sanofi Business Services, Váci Greens

Hybrid working

About The Job

Reporting directly to the Sapphire Product Owner, as a Sapphire Data Analyst you will be responsible for managing and analyzing data within the commercial vaccines data and analytics space.

This role involves ensuring data integrity, developing analytic & report ready datasets, and providing insights to support business decisions. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data management, analytics, and business intelligence.

Main Responsibilities

Reporting directly to the Sapphire Product Owner, the Data Analyst will manage business, data and organizational needs.


Leverage data and facts to identify patterns, using judgment to form conclusions that may challenge conventional wisdom, and focusing on the issues to identify high leverage intervention points and strategies
Identify and analyze business needs that support the Product strategy, harmonizing across business areas for a harmonized commercial data foundation US Vaccines. Communicate solution tradeoffs to frame and influence project decisions
Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can drive business decisions.
Design and define ingestion processes to ensure efficient data flow and integration.
Strong focus on data quality assessments, implement measures to improve data accuracy and reliability.
Ability to create detailed functional specs and test cases based off business requirements.
Strong understanding of data warehousing concepts including design patterns and load strategies.
Proactively monitor industry, functional, and technology trends.
Identify new opportunities to leverage data and to integrate data or applications to enhance business value. Including, identifying and aggregate data from internal and external sources.
Deliver in compliance with quality, regulatory (Data Privacy, GxP, SOX, etc.) and cybersecurity requirements.


About You


Bachelor’s degree in data science, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Expert in Data manipulation techniques (esp. querying tables with SQL)
Experience in a commercial pharmaceuticals/biotech/healthcare company is a strong plus
Knowledge of Six Sigma and Agile practices a plus
Must be a team player with the ability to collaborate in a fast-moving environment
Preferred Knowledge of Data Warehousing, Snowflake, SQL, ETL/ELT, Informatica, AWS, Power BI
Tools: JIRA, Confluence, Microsoft Suite, including Teams
Knowledge of data such as SAP, DDD, CDC, Veeva CRM data is highly preferred.


Why choose us?


An international work environment, in which you can develop your talent and realize ideas and innovations within a competent team
Bring the miracles of science to life alongside a supportive, future-focused team
An environment based on last technologies and frequent training to reinforce your profile
Work from an "Office of the Year 2024" finalist office


Pursue Progress. Discover Extraordinary.

Progress doesn’t happen without people – people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. You can be one of those people. Chasing change, embracing new ideas and exploring all the opportunities we have to offer. Let’s pursue progress. And let’s discover extraordinary together.

At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.

Watch our ALL IN video and check out our Diversity Equity and Inclusion actions at sanofi.com!

Discover our Code of Conduct, that serves as the moral compass that guides us when chasing the miracles of science to improve people’s lives. Please ensure to have read this document, before applying.

#Sanofi #WeNeverSettle #SanofiCareers #PursueProgress #DiscoverExtraordinary #joinsanofi #careerswithpurpose #SBSBUDAPEST

Title: Data Analyst Internship
Description:
About Us

Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us.




What You Should Know Before Applying

At Allianz, we are committed to ensure a fair hiring process and minimize unconscious bias during the screening phase. At this regard, we ask each candidate to submit their resume including only the essential information for an objective and transparent assessment of skills and experience. For example, it’s preferable to omit the photo or the city of residence before submitting the CV.




Your Challenge

You will be placed in our Rome office, within the Transformation team, where you will be responsible for supporting process automation and developing data-driven solutions.

You will be primarily responsible for the following activities:

Collaborate with business analysts or automation engineers to identify opportunities for process improvements.
Provide data-driven recommendations to support the design and implementation of automation solutions.
Assist in the development of models or algorithms for predictive analytics or decision-making processes.
Develop and maintain dashboards and regular reports that provide insights into business processes and the performance of automation systems.
Create visual representations of data that can be understood by stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
Automate reporting processes where possible to provide real-time data and insights.




You Are the Ideal Candidate If…

You have proficiency in SQL for data extraction and manipulation, and familiarity with programming languages, primarily Python and VBA.
You are competent with data visualization tools like Power BI and have basic knowledge of automation tools for business processes.
You possess skills in cleaning and preparing datasets for analysis, and experience with Excel or similar tools for data manipulation and analysis.
You have strong problem-solving aptitude to identify issues and propose data-driven solutions, and analytical thinking for evaluating data and process efficiencies.
You have collaboration skills to work effectively across different teams, and time management to handle multiple tasks and deadlines efficiently.




Why Working With Us?

Remote working? 10 days per month, plus some days of working from abroad.
360° well-being? We care about your health so you can benefit from dedicated support for your psychophysical well-being.
Discover a flexible and inclusive environment where your peace of mind and personal style truly matter.




Our Values

Customer and Market Excellence: Unwavering commitment and expertise to provide maximum support to those who rely on us.
Collaborative Leadership: Valuing people, promoting a culture of feedback and collective well-being.
Entrepreneurship: Anticipating trends and taking risks in an environment that fosters innovation and responsibility.
Trust: Acting with integrity, honoring commitments, promoting diversity and inclusion, and acting transparently for corporate social responsibility.




Certified as a Great Place to Work, Allianz Trade Italia is recognized for its focus on Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) issues and for promoting a hybrid work environment that best integrates in-person and smart working modes.

We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in. We therefore welcome applications regardless of ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation. Great to have you on board. Let's care for tomorrow.

What You Should Know Before Applying

At Allianz, we are committed to ensure a fair hiring process and minimize unconscious bias during the screening phase. At this regard, we ask each candidate to submit their resume including only the essential information for an objective and transparent assessment of skills and experience. For example, it’s preferable to omit the photo or the city of residence before submitting the CV.


Your Challenge

You will be placed in our Rome office, within the Transformation team, where you will be responsible for supporting process automation and developing data-driven solutions.

You will be primarily responsible for the following activities:

  • Collaborate with business analysts or automation engineers to identify opportunities for process improvements.
  • Provide data-driven recommendations to support the design and implementation of automation solutions.
  • Assist in the development of models or algorithms for predictive analytics or decision-making processes.
  • Develop and maintain dashboards and regular reports that provide insights into business processes and the performance of automation systems.
  • Create visual representations of data that can be understood by stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
  • Automate reporting processes where possible to provide real-time data and insights.


You Are the Ideal Candidate If…

  • You have proficiency in SQL for data extraction and manipulation, and familiarity with programming languages, primarily Python and VBA.
  • You are competent with data visualization tools like Power BI and have basic knowledge of automation tools for business processes.
  • You possess skills in cleaning and preparing datasets for analysis, and experience with Excel or similar tools for data manipulation and analysis.
  • You have strong problem-solving aptitude to identify issues and propose data-driven solutions, and analytical thinking for evaluating data and process efficiencies.
  • You have collaboration skills to work effectively across different teams, and time management to handle multiple tasks and deadlines efficiently.


Why Working With Us?

  • Remote working? 10 days per month, plus some days of working from abroad.
  • 360° well-being? We care about your health so you can benefit from dedicated support for your psychophysical well-being.
  • Discover a flexible and inclusive environment where your peace of mind and personal style truly matter.


Our Values

  • Customer and Market Excellence: Unwavering commitment and expertise to provide maximum support to those who rely on us.
  • Collaborative Leadership: Valuing people, promoting a culture of feedback and collective well-being.
  • Entrepreneurship: Anticipating trends and taking risks in an environment that fosters innovation and responsibility.
  • Trust: Acting with integrity, honoring commitments, promoting diversity and inclusion, and acting transparently for corporate social responsibility.


Certified as a Great Place to Work, Allianz Trade Italia is recognized for its focus on Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) issues and for promoting a hybrid work environment that best integrates in-person and smart working modes.

We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in. We therefore welcome applications regardless of ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation. Great to have you on board. Let's care for tomorrow.

Title: Data Analyst - Power BI / Qlik
Description:
CHI SIAMO?




IDATA GROUP è un System Integrator, nato nel 1979 e da oltre 40 anni lavora a supporto delle aziende in Italia e all’ Estero.

Grazie alle competenze acquisite negli anni, offriamo servizi di:

Sviluppo software, web, mobile, embedded, IOT
Cloud
Cybersecurity: PT, WAPT, VA, Digital Identity, DLP, Data Protection, Governance, Corporate Security
Data Analysis e Data Engineering
Business Intelligence
Sistemi GIS
Project Management e Integrazione di sistemi Innovativi







CHE RUOLO TI PROPONIAMO?




Data Analyst – Power BI / Qlik




Sei alla ricerca di un team dove poter condividere le tue idee, crescere professionalmente e mettere in pratica la tua passione per l'analisi dei dati e la Business Intelligence?

Perfetto, sei nel posto giusto!

Lavorando con noi come Data Analyst, collaborerai con un team che segue progetti internazionali e innovativi, proponendo e realizzando soluzioni di Business Intelligence con diversi strumenti, tra cui Power BI, QlikView, QlikSense e altri tool di analisi.







COSA CERCHIAMO IN TE?




Laurea in Ingegneria Informatica, Informatica o affini
Conoscenza degli strumenti per la manipolazione, visualizzazione e analisi dei dati
Almeno 2 anni di esperienza pregressa con Power BI, Qlik Sense o Qlik View
Capacità di lavorare con database e linguaggi di programmazione come SQL, DAX, Python
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese







DOVE LAVORERAI?




La sede di lavoro è Milano, con la possibilità di lavorare in modalità ibrida.







COSA PROPONE IL TEAM IDATA?




Contratto e Benefit: inserimento immediato con contratto CCNL Commercio e Servizi del Terziario;

Benefit: ticket restaurant e assicurazione sanitaria integrativa

Lavorerai con: PC Aziendale

Si lavora dal lunedì al venerdì, full time 40 ore settimanali, dalle 9 alle 18 (orario indicativo).

L’inquadramento economico verrà valutato dalla azienda a seconda delle esperienze maturate

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job

At Sanofi, we’re committed to transform the practice of medicine through break-through science. Within Sanofi, Manufacturing & Supply (M&S) is the bridge between Science and Patients, ensuring all patients get their dose reliably, that new medicines are launched faster to cover unmet needs and that they can be delivered affordably across the globe. At Sanofi we are convinced that Manufacturing is, and must in the future increasingly be, a competitive advantage and that digital unlocks every next step in that journey.

Join Sanofi Manufacturing & Supply (M&S): Where Innovation Meets Life-Saving Impact in the Heart of Lyon!

Imagine working in a vibrant startup environment, right in Lyon's bustling city center! 🏙️

Sanofi M&S offers an unparalleled playground at the intersection of drug development, advanced manufacturing, and cutting-edge AI. Here, you'll:


Support 12 blockbuster launch teams and 40 global factories across R&D and M&S
Work with real-time IoT data from state-of-the-art production and laboratory equipment
Contribute to one of the strongest treatment pipelines in biopharma
Collaborate with world-class scientists, engineers, and experts driving digital transformation


As part of our Digital M&S Accelerator, you'll develop high-value digital products to:


Accelerate yearly launches of 3-5 new blockbuster medicines (€1B+ annual revenue each)
Create best-in-class digitalized "Lighthouse" factories
Drive manufacturing performance to reduce costs by over €500M in the next five years


But wait, there's more! 🎉

Your innovative journey takes place in a prime location:


Embrace the startup vibe in our cutting-edge office space
Enjoy countless amenities right at your doorstep – from nice cafés to restaurants
Benefit from excellent public transport connections for an easy commute
Experience the perfect blend of work and life in one of France's most dynamic cities Ready to shape the future of biomanufacturing, make a real-world impact on patients' lives, and do it all from an amazing location


Join us in Lyon and be part of something extraordinary! 🚀💡

Main Responsibilities


Perform data analysis and provide input to solution design and architecture to ensure the solution meets requirements
Actively solicit stakeholder feedback on solutions and drive improvements as needed
Extracts, aggregates, manipulates, categorizes, cleans, and transforms data associated within an identified problem space
Work in close collaboration with Data scientists and data engineers to identify the right data and define proper data models
Performs exploratory data analysis and feature generation
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Create compelling data stories through great visualizations using cutting-edge technologies
Drive alignment across stakeholders on enterprise data models and definitions
Partner with stakeholders to get buy-in on, develop, and implement Sanofi’s data management standards, policies, and best practices
Implement data management and data governance best practices and standards
Recommend KPIs and develop reports to monitor adoption of and adherence to data management standards
Participate to the data analyst community of practice


As a Data Analyst, you will have a direct impact on the business by deriving insights from Data and ensuring the quality, usability, and security of Sanofi’s data. You are analytical, creative, and collaborative. You have keen attention to detail and take the time to understand our stakeholders’ data needs and challenges. You continually seek to improve your knowledge of new technologies and industry standards to drive the development of simple, yet effective solutions. You enjoy partnering with stakeholders to design and implement data management best practices and procedures. You are a self-starter, see challenges as opportunities, and are results oriented. You take pride knowing your work enables innovation and helping Sanofi build better solution.

Experience

About you


Strong understanding of databases and data structures
Exposure to tools used to support data management, specifically business glossary and metadata management, data cataloging, and data quality
Strong ability to identify, quantify, and effectively raise business risks associated with data quality or non-compliance
Experience developing best Lean & Agile practices, policies, and/or procedures
Rigorous, attention to detail to map data systems and curious to understand what is behind each data field
Understanding of privacy laws and regulations such as GxP
Experience in a healthcare company, manufacturing and supply field or chemical industry is a strong plus


Soft Skills


Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Experience working with multiple teams to drive alignment and results
Service-oriented, flexible, positive team player
Self-motivated, takes initiative
Problem solving & critical thinking


Technical Skills


Strong experience in SQL writing and profiling of Data & Python
Familiarity with data science methods and scaling data science methods
Good knowledge of cloud computing and data storages. Knowing AWS is a plus
One or multiple of the following visualization skills: Tableau, PowerBI, seaborn, matplolib, plotly, ggplot, bokeh
Project management & support: JIRA projects & service desk, Confluence, Teams


Education


Preferred qualifications: Master’s Degree in Data Analytics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics


Languages


English, French


Why choose us?


We provide a highly collaborative environment, with an opportunity to work with a world class team
Contribute to a company that is not only a leader in healthcare but also a pioneer in digital transformation, shaping the future of global health
Bring the miracles of science to life alongside a supportive, future-focused team
Discover endless opportunities to grow your talent and drive your career, whether it’s through a promotion or lateral move, at home or internationally
Enjoy a thoughtful, well-crafted rewards package that recognizes your contribution and amplifies your impact
Take good care of yourself and your family, with a wide range of health and wellbeing benefits including high-quality healthcare, prevention and wellness programs and at least 14 weeks’ gender-neutral parental leave
Play an instrumental part in creating best practice within our manufacturing facility


Pursue Progress. Discover Extraordinary.

Progress doesn’t happen without people – people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. You can be one of those people. Chasing change, embracing new ideas and exploring all the opportunities we have to offer. Let’s pursue progress. And let’s discover extraordinary together.

At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.

Watch our ALL IN video and check out our Diversity Equity and Inclusion actions at sanofi.com!

  • Rigorous, attention to detail to map data systems and curious to understand what is behind each data field
  • Understanding of privacy laws and regulations such as GxP
  • Experience in a healthcare company, manufacturing and supply field or chemical industry is a strong plus

Soft Skills

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Experience working with multiple teams to drive alignment and results
  • Service-oriented, flexible, positive team player
  • Self-motivated, takes initiative
  • Problem solving & critical thinking

Technical Skills

  • Strong experience in SQL writing and profiling of Data & Python
  • Familiarity with data science methods and scaling data science methods
  • Good knowledge of cloud computing and data storages. Knowing AWS is a plus
  • One or multiple of the following visualization skills: Tableau, PowerBI, seaborn, matplolib, plotly, ggplot, bokeh
  • Project management & support: JIRA projects & service desk, Confluence, Teams

Education

  • Preferred qualifications: Master’s Degree in Data Analytics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics

Languages

  • English, French

Why choose us?

  • We provide a highly collaborative environment, with an opportunity to work with a world class team

  • Bring the miracles of science to life alongside a supportive, future-focused team
  • Discover endless opportunities to grow your talent and drive your career, whether it’s through a promotion or lateral move, at home or internationally
  • Enjoy a thoughtful, well-crafted rewards package that recognizes your contribution and amplifies your impact

Title: CRM Data Analyst
HTML:
METRO is a global leader in wholesale food and non-food distribution, serving the needs of hotels, restaurants, catering businesses (HoReCa), and independent traders.

In 2025, we were awarded the Top Employer Romania and Europe certification for the fifth consecutive year. This certification places us among the top employers locally and in Europe. Globally, we are present in 35 countries, with 150,000 employees. We are passionate about supporting the growth of over 24 million customers, which means 24 million different challenges, ambitions and dreams.

METRO Romania was the pioneer in introducing the cash & carry sales system in Romania, in October 1996. Today, METRO Romania means:

  • More than 4,000 employees
  • 30 distribution centers across the country
  • An annual turnover of 10.5 billion lei, marking a 9% growth from the previous year.
  • A total sales area of 190,000 square meters
  • GASTRONOMETRO – Our Culinary Training Center at METRO Militari, a symbol of culinary excellence, where our specialists provide cooking courses and gastronomic consulting services to over 7,500 clients.
  • LaDoiPași – The franchise network developed by METRO, now the largest network of independent stores in Romania, with over 2,400 locations.
  • The global employer branding campaign "Shape the M" in Romania - a recognition of the contribution each METRO employee makes to the success of the company.

We are professionals working for professionals. We do business with passion. It's about speed, results, courage and team spirit. If you think alike, or if you are just curious to learn, apply on this website or log on to https://cariere.metro.ro/

Diversity and inclusion are at the heart of METRO's culture, philosophy and recruitment practices. We are committed to fostering an environment that respects the diverse perspectives, experiences and backgrounds of our employees and to promoting an inclusive, fair and accessible workplace. This includes employees of all races and ethnicities, genders, ages, abilities and sexual orientations, religious and political beliefs, military background and socio-economic status or any other legally protected factor. We ensure that people with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. At METRO, recruitment and hiring processes have been designed to ensure diversity by giving equal opportunities to all individuals, regardless of their diverse perspectives and backgrounds.



Job Description

Are you passionate about turning customer data into actionable insights? We're looking for a CRM Data Analyst to help us better understand and engage our customer base through smart reporting, campaign analysis, and data-driven support for key business initiatives.

What you’ll do:

  • Analyze and report on customer base evolution, helping the business make informed decisions;

  • Deliver performance reports for Call Center and Net Promoter Score (NPS) trends;

  • Run and evaluate SMS campaigns targeting specific customer groups;

  • Provide support for the GDPR permissions collection initiative in stores;

  • Contribute to the ARES Program by updating data (closed companies, former employees, key accounts), sending SMS notifications, and preparing related reports and evaluations.



Qualifications

What we’re looking for:

  • Knowledge of Retail / Wholesale business operations (METRO experience is a big plus);

  • Experience or strong interest in SQL, Python, Google Cloud Platform / BigQuery and Looker;

  • Strong communication and collaboration skills – you enjoy working with others across functions;

  • Curiosity and willingness to learn new tools and business processes;

  • Interest in both data analysis and understanding the business logic behind CRM activities.



Additional Information

We're ready to train and reward you as a #METROCHAMPION:

  • Lunch and holiday are provided by us through meal vouchers and holiday bonus;
  • Your health is a priority for us, that's why you benefit from private medical insurance;
  • Your performance is rewarded with team or individual bonuses;
  • You get extra days off for various occasions;
  • You have access to psychological, financial and legal counselling for you and your family;
  • You get holiday and special occasion bonuses (Christmas, Easter, 1st of June);
  • You get a referral bonus for new #METROCHAMPIONS for our team;
  • You get discounts on medical and sports subscriptions;
  • We value stability and reward it with extra vacation days and loyalty bonuses.

Title: ALTERNANCE | Data Analyst Apprentice
Description:
Position

Lorsque vous rejoignez Moët Hennessy (MH), vous entamez un parcours de carrière avec les leaders des vins, champagnes et spiritueux de luxe au sein du prestigieux groupe LVMH. Entrez dans un monde de possibilités, où les opportunités de développement de carrière à travers nos 27 Maisons, cinq régions mondiales et l'ensemble du groupe LVMH sont inégalées. Vous gérerez votre propre carrière au sein d'une main-d'œuvre passionnée et diversifiée qui s'étend sur quatre générations et combine une richesse de rôles et de compétences. L'esprit de conquête et le savoir-faire durable de nos fondateurs audacieux, passés et présents, libéreront votre créativité et vous inspireront à façonner le prochain chapitre de notre histoire intemporelle. En tant que membre de notre communauté engagée à travers le monde, et grâce aux engagements de notre programme mondial, Living Soils Living Together, vous nous aiderez à construire un héritage durable pour notre planète et pour les générations à venir.

Aux côtés de nos équipes dynamiques, vous donnerez vie aux valeurs uniques qui définissent notre parcours collectif : partage, élégance, épicurisme, intégrité et esprit de conquête.

Si vous souhaitez inspirer et être inspiré, créer des expériences et vivre le meilleur de l'artisanat, Moët Hennessy est l'endroit où vous vous épanouirez.

Job Responsibilities

Automatisation des Processus et Gestion de Projet :


Participer à l’extraction des données et l'automatisation des processus métiers liés au contrôle interne et à l’audit interne (Python, SQL, VBA, Power Automate etc.),
Travailler sur l’amélioration continue des pratiques du contrôle et audit interne en analysant les données disponibles pour identifier les tendances ou anomalies pertinentes,
Contribuer à la conception et à la maintenance des tableaux de bord Power BI pour les contrôleurs internes et auditeurs internes,
Participer à la gestion quotidienne des projets incluant la planification et le suivi des progrès via les outils de planification (ex. JIRA),
Préparer les supports de communication nécessaires pour les réunions de projet, tels que les slides PowerPoint, rapports d’avancement, comptes rendus, etc,
Assurer une communication fluide entre toutes les parties prenantes impliquées dans les missions d’audit interne et avec la communauté du Contrôle Interne,


Participer à la préparation des missions d'audit interne :


Extraction des données depuis SAP
Analyse et intégration des données dans nos rapports Power BI,
Contrôle de la cohérence des données,
Accompagnement des auditeurs dans la compréhension des données,
Participation à la réalisation des tests d’audit
Partage des conclusions avec toutes les parties prenantes (entités, maisons, etc.),
Contribution à la rédaction des rapports d'audit,


Audit IT :


Préparation des travaux d’audit IT (Demande de documents, préparation de fiches de tests, analyse des documents obtenues etc.)
Collecte, analyse et interprétation des données,
Réalisation d’échantillonnages et de tests,
Contribution à la rédaction des rapports d'audit


Profile

Formation & expérience :


École d'ingénieur en informatique ou Miage


Langues :


Français et Anglais


Compétences personnelles et interpersonnelles :


Bac+4/5
Connaissance des langages de programmation (Python, SQL, VBA)
Maîtrise d’Excel et Power BI
Connaissance des systèmes d’information (SAP est un plus)
Rigueur, agilité, sens du service, curiosité
Esprit d’équipe, initiative et autonomie
Connaissance des principes de contrôle interne et d'audit interne est un plus


Additional Information


Dates : A partir de Septembre/Octobre 2025
Lieu : Paris 7ème
Remboursement des transports à 75%
Carte de tickets-restaurant à 50%

  • Extraction des données depuis SAP
  • Analyse et intégration des données dans nos rapports Power BI,
  • Contrôle de la cohérence des données,
  • Accompagnement des auditeurs dans la compréhension des données,
  • Participation à la réalisation des tests d’audit
  • Partage des conclusions avec toutes les parties prenantes (entités, maisons, etc.),
  • Contribution à la rédaction des rapports d'audit,

Audit IT :

  • Préparation des travaux d’audit IT (Demande de documents, préparation de fiches de tests, analyse des documents obtenues etc.)
  • Collecte, analyse et interprétation des données,
  • Réalisation d’échantillonnages et de tests,
  • Contribution à la rédaction des rapports d'audit

Profile

Formation & expérience :

  • École d'ingénieur en informatique ou Miage

Langues :

  • Français et Anglais

Compétences personnelles et interpersonnelles :

  • Bac+4/5
  • Connaissance des langages de programmation (Python, SQL, VBA)
  • Maîtrise d’Excel et Power BI
  • Connaissance des systèmes d’information (SAP est un plus)
  • Rigueur, agilité, sens du service, curiosité
  • Esprit d’équipe, initiative et autonomie
  • Connaissance des principes de contrôle interne et d'audit interne est un plus

Additional Information

  • Dates : A partir de Septembre/Octobre 2025
  • Lieu : Paris 7ème
  • Remboursement des transports à 75%
  • Carte de tickets-restaurant à 50%

Title: Insights Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Dropbox isn’t just a workplace—it’s a living lab for more enlightened ways of working. We're a global community of bold visionaries and resourceful doers who are shaping the future of Dropbox—and with it the future of work. Our Virtual First model combines the autonomy of a distributed workplace with the power of human connection, making space for both meaningful work and meaningful relationships. With our start-up mindset and enterprise-level opportunities, you can be who you are and grow into who you’re meant to be. Here, you can own your impact to make work more intuitive, joyful, and human—for you as a Dropboxer and for hundreds of millions of people worldwide. If you're ready to push boundaries—and yourself— Dropbox is ready for you.

Team Description

The Dropbox Business Strategy & Operations team unlocks the company's full potential by driving strategic initiatives and enabling operational excellence. We blend analytical rigor with creative problem-solving to tackle Dropbox’s biggest opportunities and challenges across all business functions. Partnering closely with Product, Engineering, Sales, Marketing, and Finance, we turn strategic vision into actionable plans that guide growth, optimize performance, and enhance decision-making. Our work shapes the future of Dropbox by leading cross-functional business planning, developing insights that inform corporate and business unit strategies, and building the systems and processes that power scalable success. If you're passionate about strategic thinking, solving complex problems, and creating impact through collaboration, join our Business Strategy & Operations team. Areas of work include Corporate Strategy, Business Unit Strategy, Sales Operations, Business Planning, Strategic Insights, and Business Systems Development. Areas of work include Strategic Partnerships, Channel Development, Distribution Strategy, Partner Management, Revenue Growth Initiatives, and Market Expansion.

Role Description

As an Insights Analyst, you will join the Customer Analytics team which empowers informed, customer-centric decision-making by delivering reliable, insightful, actionable analytics to customer experience teams, product managers, and senior leaders to enhance the customer experience. As an Insights Analyst you are responsible for building a foundational understanding of our customers’ needs to guide decision-making. By developing, analyzing and interpreting customer metrics and operational KPIs, this role supports and advances the company’s customer-centric vision to improve CX from beginning to end.

Your focus will be on providing actionable insights to partners through a deep understanding of the customer experience with applied analytics techniques and business insights. This role isn’t just about performing analytics - it’s also about communicating insights to the business, telling a story with data that answers the “why” as well as the “what” to inform the business strategy.

This is an individual contributor role that requires exceptional analytical skills, bias toward action, strong collaboration and communication skills and a passion for customer experience.

Responsibilities


Lead end-to-end Key Performance Indicator (KPI) reporting processes, including defining and developing high-impact metrics aligned to business strategy, building and maintaining stakeholder dashboards, driving monthly reviews with operational rigor, and providing context for emerging trends
Serve as a thought partner and SME for data in specific CX or product areas, bridging the gap between technical and non-technical partners to drive continuous improvement, crafting clear actionable insights to make recommendations to the business
Perform analytics deep dives that identify opportunities to improve customer experience across the business, from product pain points to assisted or scaled support experiences
Partner closely with CX and CSO leadership to develop and execute an analytics strategy and roadmap of deliverables aligned to business goals
Translate complex concepts into implications for the business via excellent communication skills, both verbal and written


Requirements


5+ years experience in a data-centric role
Strong analytical and interpretive skills with the ability to distill copious amounts of data (qualitative, quantitative, secondary, etc.) into an insightful story with actionable recommendations for the business
Significant experience working with large amounts of data (SQL) and a deep understanding of statistical analysis, common quantitative techniques like regression
Experience in data visualization tools (for example, Tableau) and with querying large data lakes (for example, Databricks)
Proven track record of being able to drive work independently and proactively engage with business stakeholders with minimal direction, navigating through ambiguity
Ability to build strong relationships and work cross-functionally with stakeholders in a globally distributed team
Team player with a strong attention to detail and ability to meet tight deadlines
Curious and analytical mindset, with the ability to create compelling narratives and actionable recommendations from their analyses
Strong stakeholder management, up to VP level


Preferred Qualifications


Bachelors or above in quantitative discipline (e.g. Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, or related field)
Experience with Tableau, Databricks, and Snowflake
Experience with Python/R and git
Experience with surveys (design, creation, maintenance, analysis)
Experience with customer experience data and web metrics


Compensation

Ireland Pay Range

€72.300—€97.700 EUR

The range listed above is the expected annual salary/OTE (On-Target Earnings) for this role, subject to change.

Please note, OTE are for sales roles only.

Salary/OTE is just one component of Dropbox’s total rewards package. All regular employees are also eligible for the corporate bonus program or a sales incentive (target included in OTE) as well as stock in the form of Restricted Stock Units (RSUs).

Dropbox is a Virtual First company and is open to hiring candidates in all authorized locations.

Benefits

Dropbox is committed to investing in the holistic health and wellbeing of all Dropboxers and their families. Our benefits and perks programs include, but are not limited to:


Competitive medical, dental and vision coverage*
Retirement savings through a defined contribution pension or savings plan**
Flexible PTO/Paid Time Off policy in addition to statutory holidays, allowing you time to unplug, unwind, and refresh
Income Protection Plans: Life and disability insurance*
Business Travel Protection: Travel medical and accident insurance*
Perks Allowance to be used on what matters most to you, whether that’s wellness, learning and development, food & groceries, and much more
Parental benefits including: Parental Leave, Fertility Benefits, Adoptions and Surrogacy support, and Lactation support
Mental health and wellness benefits


Additional Benefits Details Are Available Upon Request.


Where group plans are not available, allowances may be provided
Benefit, amount, and type are dependent on geographical location, based upon applicable law or company policy


Dropbox is an equal opportunity employer. We are a welcoming place for everyone, and we do our best to make sure all people feel supported and connected at work. A big part of that effort is our support for members and allies of internal groups like Asians at Dropbox, BlackDropboxers, enABLE, TODOS (Latinx), Pridebox (LGBTQ), Vets at Dropbox, and Women at Dropbox.
Show more

Title: Reinsurance Data Analyst
Description:
At Abrivia, we are working with a company seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join a dynamic team specialising in data management and analytics within a global reinsurance environment. This role offers an exciting opportunity to work on international datasets, support strategic decision-making, and enhance the efficiency of data processes across the business.




Key Responsibilities

Interpret, centralise, and manage incoming data from a global client base.
Prepare internal reports for senior management, committees, and regulatory bodies.
Support data-driven decision-making through insightful analysis.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify data needs and streamline processes.
Drive innovation and efficiency in data management practices.
Contribute to continuous improvements in data quality and reporting accuracy.




Skills & Experience Required

Strong numerical and analytical abilities with clear communication skills.
Proven project or task planning capability in a data-focused environment.
Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to work in a collaborative, international setting.
Proficiency in SQL, Python, and Business Objects.
Advanced Excel skills, including the use of formulas, pivot tables, and data visualisation tools.
A proactive mindset with a focus on innovation and continuous improvement.




Please apply here or email sam.healy@abrivia.ie for more details.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
L’Open Banking è il nostro DNA!




Centrico ha le sue radici nelle rivoluzioni tecnologiche guidate dal gruppo Sella e dal 2019 è una realtà indipendente: creiamo innovazione per il mondo delle banche e della finanza con un sistema informativo aperto, veloce, modulabile e conveniente.




Il nostro obiettivo è diventare una data driven company!

Per vincere questa sfida, la persona che cerchiamo farà parte dell’area Data Management di Centrico in qualità di Data Analyst e si occuperà di analizzare i dati per fornire insights utili a supporto dei processi decisionali interni al Gruppo.




Responsabilità:

Analizzerai grandi quantità di dati per identificare trend, pattern e insights utili
Creerai report e dashboard per visualizzare i dati in modo chiaro e comprensibile
Collaborerai con team multidisciplinari (Business, IT, Compliance, Risk) per comprendere le esigenze di analisi dei dati e fornire soluzioni data-driven
Supporterai l’individuazione di regole e di livelli di controllo dell'accesso ai dati
Contribuirai al miglioramento continuo della piattaforma dati del Gruppo tramite l’implementazione di best practice e standard di settore




Requisiti:

Esperienza di almeno 4 anni nel medesimo ruolo o in ruolo affine
Laurea in discipline STEM
Conoscenza avanzata di strumenti di analisi dati (es. SQL, Python, R)
Buona conoscenza di strumenti di visualizzazione dati (es. Power BI, Tableau)
Ottime capacità relazionali sia verso interlocutori tecnici sia di business
Spiccate capacità analitiche e di problem solving




Nice to have:

Esperienza con tecnologie di big data (es. Hadoop, Spark)
Conoscenza di tecniche di machine learning e data mining
Esperienza con strumenti di ETL (es. Talend, Informatica)
Certificazioni professionali in ambito data analysis (es. Microsoft Certified: Data Analyst Associate)
Conoscenza di metodologie Agile e Scrum




Cosa offriamo:

Un ambiente positivo e in cui il tuo contributo venga apprezzato, la tua opinione è importante e vogliamo che tu la esprima
Piattaforma e-learning Microsoft: per non smettere mai di imparare e di certificarti
Attività di engagement (tornei di Beach Volley, Padel, Calcetto) e di volontariato aziendale
Contratto con CCNL del Credito
Cura della persona anche con la polizza sanitaria - per te e il tuo nucleo familiare - e polizza TCM
Supporto al benessere psicologico attraverso Stimulus, uno sportello esterno di ascolto a disposizione dei colleghi e dei loro famigliari
Uno sguardo al tuo futuro attraverso il contributo aziendale al fondo pensione
Policy di lavoro flessibile




Sede di lavoro: Milano o Torino o Biella con modalità ibrida.

Show more

Title: Analista de Datos (power BI)
Description:
La Fundación I+D Del Software Libre es un Centro de Apoyo a la innovación dónde desarrollamos y ejecutamos proyectos de I+D+I basados en las tecnologías mas punteras, cómo Realidad aumentada, Diferentes aplicaciones de la tecnología Blockchain y Ciberseguridad, además de consultoría tecnológica, nos avalan 18 años de trabajo.




Buscamos un perfil de analista de datos con Power BI y experiencia en el sector turístico con los siguientes requerimientos técnicos.

+2 años de experiencia desarrollando visualizaciones, dashboards y reportes en Power BI.
Conocimiento de modelado de datos, DAX y Power Query.
Capacidad para entender necesidades de negocio y traducirlas en soluciones visuales efectivas.
Experiencia trabajando con fuentes de datos variadas (Excel, SQL, APIs, etc.).
Precisión en la validación y depuración de datos para reportes y dashboards.
Valorable: conocimiento/experiencia en Power Platform y Microsoft Fabric.
Valorable: experiencia previa en el sector turístico, consultoría o analítica de negocio.
Espíritu analítico, proactividad y atención al detalle.
Buena comunicación.
Fuerte orientación a cliente.







¿Qué ofrecemos?

-Contrato indefinido

-Teletrabajo 100%

-Formación contínua

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a Data Analyst seeking a new interesting challenge? 🔍

If your answer is yes, it’s your lucky day so keep reading, it can be just what you're looking for! 👀




🧐 WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR IN YOU?

Experience in Data Domain, Data Dictionary, Data Governance.
Expertise (E2 at least) in SQL and preparing medium to high complexity queries. Good to have - exposure to RDBMS, NoSQL, cloud Databases - Redshift/Snowflake as well as flat files - as per real world scenarios.
Data sampling, Data quality analysis, Data Modelling.
Responsible for Data mapping deliverables (Source-to-target mappings) as well as Data dictionary providing a detailed understanding of new product builds.
Adept in analytical abilities to determine root cause for data issues with quick turnaround.
Awareness/Understanding of GDPR and Data encryption best practices and norms followed as per global IT standards.
Familiarity with Aviation domain - is an added advantage. Alternatively quick learner to adapt to Airlines Operations domain terms and terminologies - considering the client landscape.
Provide playback of role specific deliverables to Build teams to provide in depth end to end Data flow understanding for product.
Should have a good balance of business, data and moderate technical understanding - to enable effective stakeholder management.




📅 WHERE AND WHEN?

Workplace: Lisbon + hybrid work
Work Schedule: 9AM to 6PM




🤝 WHAT WE CAN OFFER YOU?

Permanent contract 📋
Pay and benefits 💸 - Competitive salary and a flexible compensation plan adapted to your needs (Ticket restaurant plan + Health Insurance).
Opportunity knocks 👍🏻 - Being a part of a growing company, we want to support your path with a career development plan and annual performance-based compensation reviews.
Learn as you grow 📚 - Starting with a fantastic onboarding program, TCS has robust learning platforms that will allow you to learn and grow personal as professionally.
Bring your buddy 👫 - If you have referred a friend for an open position under the BYB Scheme and she/he is hired you’ll receive a very attractive cash award.
Connect globally 🌏 - Work with people from all over the world. You can feel the multicultural workforce.
And so on 🎉 - Appreciations, incentives, Team Building activities, diversity and inclusion programs, sustainability activities, corporative events... This has only just begun!




💡 WHO ARE WE?

Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is an Information Technology (IT) company founded in 1968, being part of the Tata Group.

With a presence in 55 countries and over 600,000 employees, TCS is recognized as the #1 Employer in Europe by the Top Employers Institute 🥇

In our portfolio of services, we have information technology services, asset-based solutions, global consulting, engineering and industrial services, digital solutions and services, application maintenance and development, quality assurance and testing services, IT infrastructure and BPS 🎯

We stand out for our experience, reliability, passion, confidence, creativity and skills 💯




WELCOME, WE ARE WAITING FOR YOU! 🚀

Show more

  • And so on 🎉 - Appreciations, incentives, Team Building activities, diversity and inclusion programs, sustainability activities, corporative events... This has only just begun!


💡 WHO ARE WE?

Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is an Information Technology (IT) company founded in 1968, being part of the Tata Group.

With a presence in 55 countries and over 600,000 employees, TCS is recognized as the #1 Employer in Europe by the Top Employers Institute 🥇

In our portfolio of services, we have information technology services, asset-based solutions, global consulting, engineering and industrial services, digital solutions and services, application maintenance and development, quality assurance and testing services, IT infrastructure and BPS 🎯

We stand out for our experience, reliability, passion, confidence, creativity and skills 💯


WELCOME, WE ARE WAITING FOR YOU! 🚀

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Techland is one of the biggest video game companies in Poland, with over 30 years of experience in the gaming industry. From our studios in Wrocław and Warsaw, we’ve built an international team of more than 500 talented professionals, all dedicated to pushing the boundaries of game development.

We’re known for creating iconic franchises like Call of Juarez and the zombie genre-defining Dying Light, which has been played by over 45 million players worldwide. With a focus on open-world action, storytelling, and community engagement, we’re committed to delivering unforgettable experiences to our players.

We’re constantly striving to improve, innovate, and take on new challenges. With ambitious plans for the future, we’re looking for passionate people to be part of this exciting journey.

Job Description

Your daily tasks:


Proactively work on the delivery of actionable data insights derived from the in-game telemetry.
In collaboration with our developers helping to bring great games to the players.
Delivering and automating routine ad-hoc analytical tasks as a part of ongoing game operations.
Communicating the analytical results to the stakeholders of various seniority through bespoke visualizations.


Qualifications


Passion for video games.
Knowledge of SQL.
Proficiency in Math and Statistics.
Proactivity and initiative to solve problems without waiting for detailed instructions.
Flexibility and adaptability to change.
Determination and persistence when facing obstacles.
Eagerness to learn and improve continuously within our tools, techniques, and industry practices.
Very good communication and collaboration skills.
Good command of English.


Nice to have:


Experience in commercial projects related to games.
Basic knowledge of Python.


Additional Information

What we can offer:


A dedicated Buddy who will support you in your daily tasks.
A wide array of benefits: private medical care, life insurance, pro-health campaigns, gifts for different occasions.
An outstanding work atmosphere in a highly-skilled team of professionals, with flexible working hours, no dress code, and full support of the dedicated HR Business Partner.
Many opportunities for personal development: a dedicated development budget for each employee, extra two paid days for training and CSR, stable career paths, extensive internal and external training, and financing of English and Polish language classes.
State-of-the-art offices filled with chillout zones, a fully equipped kitchen, a gym (Wrocław office), and a free car park (Warsaw limited amount of space).

Title: Analista dati
HTML:
STAFF S.p.A. – Agenzia per il lavoro, filiale di Roma Eur, ricerca per cliente operante nel settore IT la figura di:


JUNIOR DATA ANALYST


L’azienda nostra cliente è una realtà focalizzata sull’innovazione tecnologica, la quale offre servizi di consulenza e servizi di Application Management e Quality Assurance, mettendo a disposizione le competenze e l’esperienza in un’offerta congiunta di sviluppo di soluzioni all’interno della propria Software Factory.

RESPONSABILITÀ:

La risorsa sarà inserita in un progetto in ambito automotive e si occuperà di:

· Gestione delle task richieste;

· Estrazioni di SQL;

· Sviluppo di query per la reportistica.


REQUISITI:


· Conoscenza di Power BI, SQL, Sevice Now;

· Pregressa esperienza nel ruolo di 1-2 anni;

· Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese (C1);

· Ottime capacità di team working;

· Ottime capacità organizzative;

· Ottime doti comunicative.

OPPORTUNITÀ:

· RAL commisurata in base alla pregressa, nella fascia tra €22k-25k;

· Buoni pasto;

· Assicurazione sanitaria a copertura integrativa;

· Percorsi di carriera personalizzati;

· Formazione professionalizzante;

· Sconti e promozioni riservate.


LUOGO DI LAVORO: Roma zona Magliana Vecchia – modalità ibrida (richiesta presenza 2 giorni a settimana)


Se desideri entrare in una realtà professionale stimolante e volta all’innovazione, candidati a questo annuncio!


I candidati sono inviatati a leggere l'informativa privacy nell'apposita sezione del sito web www.staff.it. La ricerca si intende rivolta ai candidati di ambo i sessi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91. Staff Spa. È iscritta all'albo informatico delle agenzie per il lavoro sez.1 del Ministero del lavoro e P.S.prot.N.39/00011781.

Title: Jr Analyst, Data and Insights
Description:
Job Purpose

We are now looking for a Junior Reporting Analyst to join our Data Insights Services Team. The role provides insightful, accurate and timely operational and performance reporting, and analysis to stakeholders within the European Business Units. The role offers an opportunity to work within a high-performing team focused on delivering timely and quality standard reporting, ad-hoc analysis and design of new reports.

The activities of the Data Insights Services Teams are aimed to support the decision-making process of the commercial and supply chain business units, to ultimately accelerate business performance for CCEP.

The successful candidate will combine strong analytical skills and ability to collaborate effectively and drive efficiency/continuous improvement. Curiosity about data and BI tools is essential, as well as strong communication skills.

Key Responsibilities


Prepare and distribute standard reports using BI tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau) and MS Excel based on requests from the stakeholders in an accurate and timely manner.
Extract, cleanse and validate the necessary data from the relevant systems required to produce reports.
Document report processes within the team in a standard way.
Investigates issues or performs advanced validations with senior assistance.
Work with agreed deadlines for delivering regular reports and activities to business stakeholders.
Support the implementation of Continuous Improvement initiatives.
Work in Agile environment which is characterized by flexibility, collaboration, iterative progress, and swift response to changes.
Build strong relationships with key internal stakeholders to support the execution of reporting activities and help on resolving any reporting and data issues.


Requirements


Degree level education in Information Systems, Finance or Business Studies
Min 1 year of relevant experience in a dynamic environment such as a multinational organization or a Shared Services Centre
Basic understanding of financial systems & processes


Skills which will be considered an advantage:


MS Office Suite Skills, especially Excel (including pivot tables, charts etc.), PowerPoint - intermediate
Prior experience with Power BI, Tableau, Alteryx and/or other BI tools
ERP experience, preferably SAP – Basic/Intermediate
Salesforce (or another CRM tool) – Basic/Intermediate


Behavioural competencies preferred


Analytical skills
Customer-oriented mindset
Communication skills
Structured and organized
Can-do attitude
Adaptability and flexibility
Attention to details
Other – responsible, self-motivated individual


Language capability


English – Advanced
Show more

Title: Werkstudent Business Data Analyst
Description:
Werkstudent Business Data Analyst bei Knuddels GmbH & Co. KG

Anforderungen

Wohnsitz: Nur für Bewerber aus Deutschland

Sprache: Deutsch - Muttersprachliches Niveau


Du absolvierst gerade ein laufendes Studium der Wirtschaftsinformatik, Informatik, Mathematik oder eines vergleichbaren Studiengangs
Du besitzt sehr gute Kenntnisse in SQL
Du besitzt mindestens gute Kenntnisse in Excel/Google Sheets und Python
Du verfügst über ein sehr gutes Zahlenverständnis
Du hast Freude am analytischen Denken
Du hast eine Leidenschaft für die Auswertung großer Datenmengen in Datenbanken und Google Sheets / Excel
Du hast idealerweise Vorkenntnisse in Java und kannst diese in deine Arbeit einbringen
Idealerweise hast du Kenntnisse im Testing und weißt schon was ein A/B-Test ist und wie man ihn auswertet


Tätigkeiten


Du erstellst Analysen aus vorhandenen Daten, die du vornehmlich mit SQL abfragst in Excel/ Google Sheets und Python
Du erstellst und trainierst Machine Learning Modelle
Du leitest Handlungsempfehlungen und strategische Entscheidungen zur Optimierung unseres Produkts auf Grundlage der gewonnenen Erkenntnisse ab und hast dabei auch immer im Blick, dass die benötigten Daten korrekt und vollständig vorliegen
Du berätst unsere Product Manager anhand deiner Analysen zur Vorbereitung von Tests und Features
Du verbesserst gegebenenfalls unseren nächtlichen Reload zum Datensammeln unter Einsatz von Java und SQL


Team

Wir sind ein tatkräftiges Team aus 56 Personen, darunter 25 Entwickler*innen. Wir haben ein sehr gutes Betriebsklima, unser Team besteht aus ganz vielen unterschiedlichen Charakteren (grob gesagt: Nerds und Nerd Compensators), die agil zusammenarbeiten und offen miteinander kommunizieren.

Über das Unternehmen

Seit 1999 bringt unsere Chat-Plattform Menschen näher zusammen

Mit mehr als 300.000 monatlich aktiven Mitgliedern in mehr als 1.000 aktiven Chaträumen sind wir Deutschlands größte Chat-Community. In einer schnelllebigen und stark umkämpften Branche können wir nur bestehen, weil uns Werte wie Offenheit, Vielfalt und Inklusion am Herzen liegen und wir ein klasse Team sind. Unser gemeinsames Ziel ist es, ein herausragendes Produkt zu schaffen, das unsere Mitglieder bewegt und begeistert.

Klicke auf "Bewerben" für Details zu den Benefits, dem Team und dem Bewerbungsprozess.
